# Results {#sec-results}

## Model Performance Overview

Our analysis evaluated two machine learning models on the CDC diabetes prediction task: Decision Tree and Naive Bayes classifiers.

```{python}
#| label: load-evaluation-functions
#| echo: false
#| include: false

# Import functions from your script
import sys
import os
sys.path.append(os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'scripts'))

from model_evaluation_06 import (
    load_test_data, 
    load_pickle_models, 
    create_score_table, 
)

# Load data and models
X_test, y_test = load_test_data()
tree_model, nb_model = load_pickle_models()
```

```{python}
#| label: tbl-model-performance
#| tbl-cap: "Model Performance Comparison on Test Set"
#| echo: false

# Create and display the performance table
score_table = create_score_table(X_test, y_test, tree_model, nb_model)
score_table
```

As shown in @tbl-model-performance, the Decision Tree model achieved an accuracy of `{python} f"{score_table. loc[0, 'Test Accuracy']:.3f}"` compared to the Naive Bayes model's accuracy of `{python} f"{score_table.loc[1, 'Test Accuracy']:. 3f}"`.
